Metadata.Creator: IPSV Board convened by the e-Government Unit
Metadata.Description: Hierarchy for the Integrated Public Service Vocabulary
Metadata.Title: Integrated Public Service Vocabulary-Hierarchy

Item.Name: Key workers
Item.ScopeNotes: Persons employed in a frontline role in the public sector, delivering essential public services in an area where there are serious recruitment and retention problems, and who may therefore be eligible for help with affordable housing

Item.Name: Council opportunities
Item.ScopeNotes: Opportunities for obtaining business from local authorities

Item.Name: Business management
Item.ScopeNotes: Applicable to public, private and voluntary organisations

Item.Name: Business planning
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to public as well as private sector bodies

Item.Name: Corporate social responsibility
Item.ScopeNotes: Policies that contribute to the sustainable development of society, considering the economic, social and environmental impacts of business activities

Item.Name: Budget control
Item.ScopeNotes: Monitoring and reporting of budgets against plan

Item.Name: Business finance
Item.ScopeNotes: Raising and managing of funds by business organisations

Item.Name: Cost control
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Debt management
Item.ScopeNotes: Activities involved in managing the debts owed to the business or public sector body

Item.Name: Compensation
Item.ScopeNotes: Recompense for loss, injury or damage

Item.Name: Public expenditure
Item.HistoryNotes: In Version 1 the preferred term for this concept was 'Government spending'; the latter is now a non-preferred term.

Item.Name: Spending reviews
Item.ScopeNotes: Reviews which set limits for the expenditure of government departments and, through Public Service Agreements, define the key improvements that the public can expect from these resources.

Item.Name: Procurement
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the public sector. As of Version 2, it is applicable equally to the public and private sectors. In line with this change of scope, it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Public administration'.

Item.Name: Purchasing
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the private sector. As of Version 2, it is equally applicable to private and public sectors and it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Financial management'.

Item.Name: Commissions for supplies to government bodies
Contracts for supplies to government bodies
Human resource management
Item.HistoryNotes: In Version 1 the preferred term for this concept was Personnel management; Human resource management was promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Attendance management
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to job attendance and not to attendance by schoolchildren

Item.Name: Employment terms and conditions
Item.HistoryNotes: Term added in Version 2. Previously the preferred term for the same concept was 'Working hours, terms and conditions'.

Item.Name: Homeworking
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term of 'Teleworking'; promoted in Version 2.

Item.Name: Hours of work
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Annual leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Maternity leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Public holidays
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Sick leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Minimum wage
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term of Living standards and income levels; promoted to preferred term and moved in Version 2

Item.Name: Equal pay
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Shiftwork
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Capability procedures
Item.ScopeNotes: Procedures to assess and deal with incompetence at work

Item.Name: Protection of Children Act List checks
Termination of employment
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term for 'Dismissal and redundancy', which has been split into two as of Version 2

Item.Name: Dismissal
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously there was just one preferred term 'Dismissal and redundancy', but this has now been split into its separate components, which each have preferred terms

Item.Name: Redundancy
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, the broader term was named 'Dismissal and redundancy'

Item.Name: Early retirement
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Workplace training and development
Item.ScopeNotes: Learning and development while in work, including training courses, conferences, mentoring, etc.

Item.Name: Work experience
Item.RelatedItem: School links with home, community and business

Item.Name: Data security
Item.ScopeNotes: Measures to protect data/information from loss, corruption, interference or theft

Item.Name: Information architecture
Item.ScopeNotes: Structural design of shared information environments, embracing all stages from information creation through to dissemination and use

Item.Name: Records management
Item.RelatedItem: Electronic document and records management systems

Item.Name: Budget control
Item.ScopeNotes: Monitoring and reporting of budgets against plan

Item.Name: Organisational development
Item.ScopeNotes: Strategy, planning and implementation to ensure that an organisation and its workforce are appropriately positioned to deliver desired outcomes

Item.Name: Change management
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under Business management; moved under Organisational development when this term was introduced in Version 2

Item.Name: Relocation
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes relocation of any kind of organisation or part of the organisation and/or its staff
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously the preferred term was Business relocation, located under Business development. The former is now a non-preferred term and the concept has moved to be under Organisational change.

Item.Name: Performance management
Item.ScopeNotes: The process and outcomes of reviewing effectiveness and efficiency in organisations and business units, especially in the delivery of public services. For performance appraisal of individuals, see 'Performance appraisal'

Item.Name: Best value
Item.ScopeNotes: The duty of continuous improvement for local authorities as set by the Local Government Act 1999, concerning efficiency, effectiveness and economy of services to the public

Item.Name: Best value performance plan
Item.ScopeNotes: An annual report produced by local authorities detailing current performance levels, actions of the councils, and future performance standards expected

Item.Name: Competitiveness
Item.ScopeNotes: The ability of businesses to compete in local, national or international markets

Item.Name: Performance indicators
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under Performance management; moved under Performance measurement in Version 2

Item.Name: Benchmarking
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Quality assurance
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term of Quality management; promoted in Version 2, bringing the non-preferred term Quality control with it.

Item.Name: Hallmarking
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under Quality management; moved to under Quality assurance in Version 2

Item.Name: Home authority advice
Item.ScopeNotes: Advice from the local authority where the relevant decision making base of an enterprise is located. The advice may cover regulation, good practice and remedial action

Item.Name: PRINCE2
Item.ScopeNotes: A methodology for project management, widely used in the UK public sector

Item.Name: Public relations
Item.ScopeNotes: Activities undertaken by an organisation to explain its policies and operations to the public, including media briefings, publishing, responding to enquiries, etc.

Item.Name: Public consultation
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained a new broader term of 'Consultation' when this term was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Consultations on education
Item.ScopeNotes: Consultation with those potentially affected by proposed changes in education provision.

Item.Name: Building maintenance
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional Broader Term of Resource management, when the latter term was introduced in Version 2

Item.Name: Heating installation and repairs
Item.HistoryNotes: The link up to Building maintenance was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Procurement
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the public sector. As of Version 2, it is applicable equally to the public and private sectors. In line with this change of scope, it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Public administration'.

Item.Name: Purchasing
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the private sector. As of Version 2, it is equally applicable to private and public sectors and it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Financial management'.

Item.Name: Commissions for supplies to government bodies
Contracts for supplies to government bodies
Business continuity planning
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Fair trade
Item.ScopeNotes: A basis for ethical trade with partners in developing countries, aiming to encourage sustainable development and improved working conditions

Item.Name: RIDDOR (reporting of injuries, diseases and dangerous occurrences)
Fire prevention
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes training and education in fire prevention

Item.Name: Health and safety investigations
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Health and safety requirements
Item.HistoryNotes: As of Version 2, term has moved from previous position, directly under 'Health and safety at work'

Item.Name: Adventure activities licences
Item.ScopeNotes: Licences for those offering adventure activities in a commercial manner to people under the age of 18 years, in remote or isolated places

Item.Name: Explosives licences
Item.ScopeNotes: Licences for the storage and/or sale of fireworks and other explosive materials

Item.Name: Licences to kill or take game
Licences for uploading petrol into storage tanks
Scaffolding licences
Item.HistoryNotes: A link to the additional broader term 'Business licences' was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Skip licences
Item.HistoryNotes: A link to the additional broader term 'Business licences' was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations
Building and construction licences (materials on highways)
Telephone services
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional broader term of 'Telecommunications' when the latter term was introduced in Version 2.

Item.Name: Manufacturing
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes assembly as well as manufacturing

Item.Name: Meat and livestock industries
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes livestock farming and all animal dealings prior to arrival at market

Item.Name: Compensation
Item.ScopeNotes: Recompense for loss, injury or damage

Item.Name: Customer satisfaction
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to customers of public and academic as well as private sector organisations

Item.Name: Fair trade
Item.ScopeNotes: A basis for ethical trade with partners in developing countries, aiming to encourage sustainable development and improved working conditions

Item.Name: Regeneration
Item.ScopeNotes: Social or economic regeneration of districts, areas or communities

Item.Name: AVCs (Additional voluntary contributions) for occupational pensions
Public expenditure
Item.HistoryNotes: In Version 1 the preferred term for this concept was 'Government spending'; the latter is now a non-preferred term.

Item.Name: Spending reviews
Item.ScopeNotes: Reviews which set limits for the expenditure of government departments and, through Public Service Agreements, define the key improvements that the public can expect from these resources.

Item.Name: Public funding
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes any kind of financial support or contract from central, European, regional and local government sources, available to the voluntary sector and community groups, as well as to businesses and individuals; also the funding of public sector projects and initiatives from any source.

Item.Name: Tax
Item.ScopeNotes: Use this broad category for any tax not specifically listed as a narrower term

Item.Name: Adult and community education
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes all forms of learning and skills development for people over the age of 16, except for formal education leading to a university or college degree

Item.Name: Educational institutions (adult and community education centres)
Family learning
Item.ScopeNotes: Family learning encourages parents/carers to learn together with their children

Item.Name: Further and higher education management
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes institutional finance and organisation

Item.Name: Business and Technology Education Council courses
Highers
Item.ScopeNotes: Exams/qualifications within the Scottish Credit and Qualifications Framework, normally taken at the end of the fifth year of secondary education

Item.Name: Learning and teaching methods
Item.RelatedItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: e-Learning
Item.ScopeNotes: The application of information and communication technology to learning, teaching, training and/or skills development
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: ICT in learning
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a preferred term; demoted to non-preferred in Version 2

Item.Name: Inclusive education
Item.ScopeNotes: Education of children with disabilities in the general school system
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Alternatives to school
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Consultations on education
Item.ScopeNotes: Consultation with those potentially affected by proposed changes in education provision.

Item.Name: General Certificate of Secondary Education courses
Standard Grades
Item.ScopeNotes: Exams/qualifications within the Scottish Credit and Qualifications Framework, normally taken at the end of the fourth year of secondary education

Item.Name: Information and communication technologies education at school
Personal, social and health education at school
Out of school activities
Item.ScopeNotes: Activities associated with school, held out of school hours and/or off school premises

Item.Name: Gifted children
Item.BroaderItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: School links with home, community and business
Parent staff associations
Item.BroaderItem: School links with home, community and business

Item.Name: Business links with schools
Item.UseItem: School links with home, community and business

Item.Name: Community links with schools
Item.UseItem: School links with home, community and business

Item.Name: Parent links with schools
Item.UseItem: School links with home, community and business

Item.Name: Foundation schools
Item.ScopeNotes: The governing body employs the school's staff and has primary responsibility for admission arrangements. The school's land and buildings are owned by the governing body or by a charitable foundation.

Item.Name: Specialist schools
Item.ScopeNotes: These schools receive additional funding to help them raise standards, focussing on one (or two) specialist subject areas while still meeting National Curriculum requirements

Item.Name: Special schools
Item.ScopeNotes: Schools for groups of children with special educational needs
Item.BroaderItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Supplementary schools
Item.ScopeNotes: Saturday schools and other supplementary provision, usually cultural initiatives by parents.

Item.Name: Voluntary aided schools
Item.ScopeNotes: The governing body employ the school's staff, contribute towards capital costs and have primary responsibility for admission arrangements. The school's land and buildings are normally owned by a charitable foundation.

Item.Name: Voluntary controlled schools
Item.ScopeNotes: The LEA employs the school's staff and has primary responsibility for admission arrangements. The school's land and buildings are normally owned by a charitable trust.

Item.Name: Business and Technology Education Council courses
Highers
Item.ScopeNotes: Exams/qualifications within the Scottish Credit and Qualifications Framework, normally taken at the end of the fifth year of secondary education

Item.Name: English for speakers of other languages
English as a foreign language
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: English as a second language courses
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: ESL (English as a second language)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: ESOL (English for speakers of other languages)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: TEFL (Teaching English as a foreign language)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: TESL (Teaching English as a Second Language)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: Speech training
Item.ScopeNotes: Elocution, public speaking and other oral communication skills

Item.Name: Self-help for people with learning difficulties
Special educational needs and additional support
Item.ScopeNotes: Educational arrangements for those with learning difficulties, and support for other special cases e.g. talented or gifted children, or those disadvantaged by language or gender

Item.Name: Gifted children
Item.BroaderItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Special schools
Item.ScopeNotes: Schools for groups of children with special educational needs
Item.BroaderItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Additional support needs (education)
Item.UseItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: SEN (special educational needs)
Item.UseItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Special education needs
Item.UseItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Special needs education
Item.UseItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Workplace training and development
Item.ScopeNotes: Learning and development while in work, including training courses, conferences, mentoring, etc.

Item.Name: Work experience
Item.RelatedItem: School links with home, community and business

Item.Name: Careers advice
Item.ScopeNotes: Advice on available career paths, the qualifications and other attributes recommended for particular careers

Item.Name: Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations
Adoption rights
Item.ScopeNotes: Special rights concerning pay and leave for employees with an adopted child

Item.Name: Maternity leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations
Employment terms and conditions
Item.HistoryNotes: Term added in Version 2. Previously the preferred term for the same concept was 'Working hours, terms and conditions'.

Item.Name: Homeworking
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term of 'Teleworking'; promoted in Version 2.

Item.Name: Hours of work
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Annual leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Maternity leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Public holidays
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Sick leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Minimum wage
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term of Living standards and income levels; promoted to preferred term and moved in Version 2

Item.Name: Equal pay
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Shiftwork
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Equal opportunities and diversity
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to the opportunities that individuals meet in selection for education, employment, promotion, and valuing and using the differences in people to their best advantage.

Item.Name: Age discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Unfair treatment of people on the basis of their age, especially where it concerns older people.

Item.Name: Disability discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to employees or prospective employees who are treated less favourably because of a mental or physical disability.

Item.Name: Racial discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Discrimination between individuals on racial grounds, in the context of selection for education, employment and promotion

Item.Name: Religious discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Discrimination between individuals on religious grounds, in the context of selection for education, employment or promotion.

Item.Name: Sexual discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Discrimination between individuals on the basis of gender, in the context of selection for education, employment or promotion.

Item.Name: Sheltered employment
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located under Employment terms and conditions; moved in Version 2

Item.Name: RIDDOR (reporting of injuries, diseases and dangerous occurrences)
Fire prevention
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes training and education in fire prevention

Item.Name: Health and safety investigations
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Health and safety requirements
Item.HistoryNotes: As of Version 2, term has moved from previous position, directly under 'Health and safety at work'

Item.Name: Termination of employment
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term for 'Dismissal and redundancy', which has been split into two as of Version 2

Item.Name: Dismissal
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously there was just one preferred term 'Dismissal and redundancy', but this has now been split into its separate components, which each have preferred terms

Item.Name: Redundancy
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, the broader term was named 'Dismissal and redundancy'

Item.Name: Early retirement
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Employment counselling (finding a job)
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously the preferred term 'Employment counselling' was under 'Employment, jobs and careers'. As of Version 2, the former term has been modified and made a non-preferred term of 'Unemployment advice services'.

Item.Name: Volunteering
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional broader term of 'Employment, jobs and careers' in Version 2

Item.Name: Environmental protection
Item.ScopeNotes: Covers degradation issues and human impact on the environment, as well as conservation and protection measures

Item.Name: Agenda 21 implementation
Item.ScopeNotes: Action at a local or national level to implement the Agenda 21 Treaty signed internationally at the 1992 Earth Summit

Item.Name: Environmentally Sensitive Areas
Item.ScopeNotes: Designated areas of the countryside which are safeguarded because the landscape, wildlife and historic interest are of national importance.

Item.Name: Nature reserves
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located in one hierarchy only; additional location under Countryside added in Version 2

Item.Name: Light pollution
Item.ScopeNotes: Brightening of the night sky caused by artificial light

Item.Name: Farming
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes arable farming and all types of livestock farming except fish farming

Item.Name: Accessible buildings
Item.ScopeNotes: Buildings which allow easy access for disabled people

Item.Name: Disabled toilets
Item.ScopeNotes: Toilet facilities and installations designed for use by disabled people

Item.Name: Building maintenance
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional Broader Term of Resource management, when the latter term was introduced in Version 2

Item.Name: Heating installation and repairs
Item.HistoryNotes: The link up to Building maintenance was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Nature reserves
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located in one hierarchy only; additional location under Countryside added in Version 2

Item.Name: Non-residential property
Item.ScopeNotes: Land and/or buildings in the public or private sector, other than residential property or agricultural land.

Item.Name: Animal health
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes animal disease (but note certain diseases are listed separately)

Item.Name: Civic amenity sites
Item.ScopeNotes: Sites designated by local authorities for the public to bring items for disposal or recycling

Item.Name: Household waste collection
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes the collection of garden waste or items for recycling

Item.Name: Skip licences
Item.HistoryNotes: A link to the additional broader term 'Business licences' was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Special waste collections
Item.ScopeNotes: Special collections for removing bulky items of household waste. Hazardous waste is not included.

Item.Name: Landfill sites
Item.ScopeNotes: Licensed facilities where waste is permanently deposited for disposal.

Item.Name: Executive agencies
Item.ScopeNotes: All executive agencies, whether they report to Westminster departments or to devolved administrations

Item.Name: Ministers
Item.ScopeNotes: Use for items dealing with activities or views of a Minister that fall outside the scope of his or her ministerial responsibilities, or for a broad profile of the Minister. Items that do deal with normal ministerial responsibilities should be assigned to the appropriate topic-related category.

Item.Name: Prime Minister
Item.ScopeNotes: Use for broad profiles of the Prime Minister, or for items about the machinery and activities of the Prime Minister's Office or for more general items relating to the lifestyle and ethics of the Prime Minister. Items that deal with normal duties should be assigned to the appropriate topic-related category

Item.Name: North-South bodies
Item.ScopeNotes: Bodies set up under the Belfast agreement, representing Oireachtas Eireann and the Northern Ireland Assembly, to discuss matters of common interest

Item.Name: Complaints procedure (local government)
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes grievances of employees, for which 'Staff grievances' should be used.

Item.Name: Policy making
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes the processes by which government departments and local authorities formulate, implement and evaluate policies

Item.Name: Business management
Item.ScopeNotes: Applicable to public, private and voluntary organisations

Item.Name: Business planning
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to public as well as private sector bodies

Item.Name: Corporate social responsibility
Item.ScopeNotes: Policies that contribute to the sustainable development of society, considering the economic, social and environmental impacts of business activities

Item.Name: Budget control
Item.ScopeNotes: Monitoring and reporting of budgets against plan

Item.Name: Business finance
Item.ScopeNotes: Raising and managing of funds by business organisations

Item.Name: Cost control
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Debt management
Item.ScopeNotes: Activities involved in managing the debts owed to the business or public sector body

Item.Name: Compensation
Item.ScopeNotes: Recompense for loss, injury or damage

Item.Name: Public expenditure
Item.HistoryNotes: In Version 1 the preferred term for this concept was 'Government spending'; the latter is now a non-preferred term.

Item.Name: Spending reviews
Item.ScopeNotes: Reviews which set limits for the expenditure of government departments and, through Public Service Agreements, define the key improvements that the public can expect from these resources.

Item.Name: Procurement
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the public sector. As of Version 2, it is applicable equally to the public and private sectors. In line with this change of scope, it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Public administration'.

Item.Name: Purchasing
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the private sector. As of Version 2, it is equally applicable to private and public sectors and it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Financial management'.

Item.Name: Commissions for supplies to government bodies
Contracts for supplies to government bodies
Human resource management
Item.HistoryNotes: In Version 1 the preferred term for this concept was Personnel management; Human resource management was promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to job attendance and not to attendance by schoolchildren

Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, the broader term was named 'Dismissal and redundancy'

Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.ScopeNotes: Learning and development while in work, including training courses, conferences, mentoring, etc.

Item.Name: Data security
Item.ScopeNotes: Measures to protect data/information from loss, corruption, interference or theft

Item.Name: Information architecture
Item.ScopeNotes: Structural design of shared information environments, embracing all stages from information creation through to dissemination and use

Item.Name: Records management
Item.RelatedItem: Electronic document and records management systems

Item.ScopeNotes: Monitoring and reporting of budgets against plan

Item.Name: Organisational development
Item.ScopeNotes: Strategy, planning and implementation to ensure that an organisation and its workforce are appropriately positioned to deliver desired outcomes

Item.Name: Change management
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under Business management; moved under Organisational development when this term was introduced in Version 2

Item.Name: Relocation
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes relocation of any kind of organisation or part of the organisation and/or its staff
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously the preferred term was Business relocation, located under Business development. The former is now a non-preferred term and the concept has moved to be under Organisational change.

Item.Name: Performance management
Item.ScopeNotes: The process and outcomes of reviewing effectiveness and efficiency in organisations and business units, especially in the delivery of public services. For performance appraisal of individuals, see 'Performance appraisal'

Item.Name: Best value
Item.ScopeNotes: The duty of continuous improvement for local authorities as set by the Local Government Act 1999, concerning efficiency, effectiveness and economy of services to the public

Item.Name: Best value performance plan
Item.ScopeNotes: An annual report produced by local authorities detailing current performance levels, actions of the councils, and future performance standards expected

Item.Name: Competitiveness
Item.ScopeNotes: The ability of businesses to compete in local, national or international markets

Item.Name: Performance indicators
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under Performance management; moved under Performance measurement in Version 2

Item.Name: Benchmarking
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Quality assurance
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term of Quality management; promoted in Version 2, bringing the non-preferred term Quality control with it.

Item.Name: Hallmarking
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under Quality management; moved to under Quality assurance in Version 2

Item.Name: Home authority advice
Item.ScopeNotes: Advice from the local authority where the relevant decision making base of an enterprise is located. The advice may cover regulation, good practice and remedial action

Item.Name: PRINCE2
Item.ScopeNotes: A methodology for project management, widely used in the UK public sector

Item.Name: Public relations
Item.ScopeNotes: Activities undertaken by an organisation to explain its policies and operations to the public, including media briefings, publishing, responding to enquiries, etc.

Item.Name: Public consultation
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained a new broader term of 'Consultation' when this term was added in Version 2

Item.ScopeNotes: Consultation with those potentially affected by proposed changes in education provision.

Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional Broader Term of Resource management, when the latter term was introduced in Version 2

Item.Name: Heating installation and repairs
Item.HistoryNotes: The link up to Building maintenance was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Procurement
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the public sector. As of Version 2, it is applicable equally to the public and private sectors. In line with this change of scope, it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Public administration'.

Item.Name: Purchasing
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously this term was applied only to the private sector. As of Version 2, it is equally applicable to private and public sectors and it has moved from its previous location directly under 'Financial management'.

Item.Name: Commissions for supplies to government bodies
Contracts for supplies to government bodies
Business continuity planning
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Public bodies
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes the Cabinet, government departments, executive agencies, devolved administrations, regional development agencies and local government authorities

Item.Name: Public consultation
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained a new broader term of 'Consultation' when this term was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Consultations on education
Item.ScopeNotes: Consultation with those potentially affected by proposed changes in education provision.

Item.Name: Local Area Agreements
Item.ScopeNotes: Agreements that take account of local and national priorities for the delivery of public service outcomes in particular localities.

Item.Name: Health, well-being and care
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes Defence medical services

Item.Name: Animal health
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes animal disease (but note certain diseases are listed separately)

Item.Name: Benefits
Item.ScopeNotes: All types of benefit payments except those relating specifically to pensions

Item.Name: Maternity grants from the social fund
Behaviour support services
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Care for disabled people
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, the preferred term was 'Care for the disabled'

Item.Name: Self-help for people with learning difficulties
Care for older people
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, the preferred term was 'Care for the elderly'

Item.Name: Child protection
Item.ScopeNotes: Safeguarding children from neglect or physical, emotional or sexual abuse

Item.Name: Day care centres
Item.ScopeNotes: Centres providing support services and facilities for older people and people with disabilities, during the daytime

Item.Name: Helplines (care services)
Item.ScopeNotes: Telephone support services, some of which provide care advice while others will deliver emergency response.

Item.Name: Sitting with disabled or older people
Youth services
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes youth clubs and voluntary youth organisations as well as services provided to young people by statutory bodies

Item.Name: Accessible buildings
Item.ScopeNotes: Buildings which allow easy access for disabled people

Item.Name: Disabled toilets
Item.ScopeNotes: Toilet facilities and installations designed for use by disabled people

Item.Name: Care for disabled people
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, the preferred term was 'Care for the disabled'

Item.Name: Self-help for people with learning difficulties
Disabled people
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Disabled children
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Emergency alarms (sick, elderly or disabled people)
Reading machines
Item.ScopeNotes: Scanned text is converted to large print, Braille or synthesised speech

Item.Name: Incapacity
Item.ScopeNotes: Inability to work, because of an illness or disability

Item.Name: Self-help for people with learning difficulties
Drinks
Item.ScopeNotes: All types of drink except milk

Item.Name: Licensed premises transfer licences (sale of alcohol)
Drugs use and abuse
Item.ScopeNotes: The use of drugs for non-medical purposes including drug abuse and addiction

Item.Name: Environmental health
Item.ScopeNotes: Health concerns arising from environmental factors

Item.Name: Illnesses
Item.ScopeNotes: Diseases, disorders, medical and other conditions adverse to the health of humans. For diseases of animals, use 'Animal health'. For diseases of plants, use 'Plant health'.

Item.Name: Medicines
Item.ScopeNotes: Drugs intended for medical uses

Item.Name: Drug rehabilitation
Item.ScopeNotes: Treatment for dependency on any type of drug, including alcohol

Item.Name: Speech therapy
Item.ScopeNotes: Therapy addressing communication problems such as delayed language, stammering, aphasia, voice problems

Item.Name: Mental health and learning disabilities trusts
Neighbourhood watch
Item.ScopeNotes: Any scheme organised by groups of owners or residents to protect their property from theft or other types of crime, especially with the support of police authorities

Item.Name: Fire prevention
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes training and education in fire prevention

Item.Name: Houses in multiple occupation
Item.ScopeNotes: House occupied by persons who do not form a single household

Item.Name: Heating installation and repairs
Item.HistoryNotes: The link up to Building maintenance was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Insulation
Item.ScopeNotes: Thermal insulation of buildings, houses, parts of houses and heating installations. Electrical insulation is not included.

Item.Name: Social housing
Item.ScopeNotes: Housing owned and/or managed by a local authority or housing association

Item.Name: Hard to let and easy to access properties
Easy access scheme housing
Item.UseItem: Hard to let and easy to access properties

Item.Name: Public consultation
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained a new broader term of 'Consultation' when this term was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Consultations on education
Item.ScopeNotes: Consultation with those potentially affected by proposed changes in education provision.

Item.Name: English for speakers of other languages
English as a foreign language
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: English as a second language courses
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: ESL (English as a second language)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: ESOL (English for speakers of other languages)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: TEFL (Teaching English as a foreign language)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: TESL (Teaching English as a Second Language)
Item.UseItem: English for speakers of other languages

Item.Name: Information
Item.ScopeNotes: Use this term to tag resources that are ABOUT information; not for resources that simply ARE information.

Item.Name: Metadata
Item.HistoryNotes: Promoted in Version 2 from non-preferred term in Version 1

Item.Name: Freedom of information
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under 'Information and communication'; moved to under 'Information' when the latter term was introduced in Version 2.

Item.Name: Intelligence (information)
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously known as just 'Intelligence', and located directly under 'Information and communication'; qualifier added and term moved to under 'Information' when the latter term was introduced in Version 2.

EDRM (electronic document and records management) systems

Item.UseItem: Electronic document and records management systems

Item.UseItem: Electronic document and records management systems

Item.UseItem: Electronic document and records management systems

Item.Name: Email
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under 'Information and communication technology'; moved to under 'Computer applications' and 'Telecommunications' when the latter terms were introduced in Version 2.

Item.Name: e-Learning
Item.ScopeNotes: The application of information and communication technology to learning, teaching, training and/or skills development
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: ICT in learning
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a preferred term; demoted to non-preferred in Version 2

Item.Name: Computers
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under 'Information and communication technology'; moved to under 'Hardware' when the latter term was introduced in Version 2.

Item.Name: Internet
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, location was directly under 'Information and communication technology'.

Item.Name: Change control
Item.ScopeNotes: Mechanisms and procedures governing the updating of IT resources such as standards, specifications, software

Item.Name: Email
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under 'Information and communication technology'; moved to under 'Computer applications' and 'Telecommunications' when the latter terms were introduced in Version 2.

Item.Name: Internet
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, location was directly under 'Information and communication technology'.

Item.Name: Satellite dishes
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located directly under 'Information and communication technology'; moved to under 'Telecommunications' when the latter term was introduced in Version 2. Additional broader term of 'Structures and installations' has not changed.

Item.Name: Telephone services
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional broader term of 'Telecommunications' when the latter term was introduced in Version 2.

Item.Name: Data security
Item.ScopeNotes: Measures to protect data/information from loss, corruption, interference or theft

Item.Name: Information architecture
Item.ScopeNotes: Structural design of shared information environments, embracing all stages from information creation through to dissemination and use

Item.Name: Records management
Item.RelatedItem: Electronic document and records management systems

Item.Name: Journalism
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to audiovisual and/or printed media

Item.Name: Privacy and data protection
Item.ScopeNotes: Measures to protect personal data from unauthorised disclosure or interference, as well as general protection of privacy

Item.Name: Public relations
Item.ScopeNotes: Activities undertaken by an organisation to explain its policies and operations to the public, including media briefings, publishing, responding to enquiries, etc.

Item.Name: Public consultation
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained a new broader term of 'Consultation' when this term was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Consultations on education
Item.ScopeNotes: Consultation with those potentially affected by proposed changes in education provision.

Item.Name: Girls Venture Corps
Item.HistoryNotes: Moved to under 'Cadet forces' in Version 2. Previously located directly under 'Young people's organisations'

Item.Name: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
United Nations
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes UN agencies as well as the central organisation

Item.Name: FAO (Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN)
Overseas conflict
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes internal conflicts in other countries as well as wars, in which the UK may or may not be involved

Item.Name: Interpretive centres (museums and interactive science centres)
Comedy clubs
Item.ScopeNotes: Venues usually used by stand-up comedians to perform

Item.Name: Heritage
Item.ScopeNotes: Historic buildings and archaeological sites, and their presentation, study and management

Item.Name: Portable antiquities
Item.ScopeNotes: Portable archaeological objects discovered by members of the public

Item.Name: Mills
Item.HistoryNotes: Prior to Version 2, this term was located directly under 'Heritage'.

Item.Name: Play by mail games
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes games played by postal or electronic mail

Item.Name: Portable antiquities
Item.ScopeNotes: Portable archaeological objects discovered by members of the public

Item.Name: Living history
Item.ScopeNotes: A re-enactment of history aiming to educate, inform or research a particular period of time by bringing it to life. Re-enactments sometimes focus on special events, such as battles, but more usually are based around day-to-day life at a particular place and time.

Item.Name: Town parks
Item.ScopeNotes: For recreational use, not for the parking of vehicles. (See Car parks)

Item.Name: Sports information and ticketing
Item.ScopeNotes: Tickets, reservations and information about sporting events

Item.Name: Adventure activities licences
Item.ScopeNotes: Licences for those offering adventure activities in a commercial manner to people under the age of 18 years, in remote or isolated places

Item.Name: Riding schools
Item.ScopeNotes: Establishments which keep horses for hire out and/or for riding instruction

Item.Name: Educational institutions (adult and community education centres)
Civic amenity sites
Item.ScopeNotes: Sites designated by local authorities for the public to bring items for disposal or recycling

Item.Name: Disabled toilets
Item.ScopeNotes: Toilet facilities and installations designed for use by disabled people

Item.Name: Population and migration
Item.ScopeNotes: For internal migration and population distribution, rather than immigration issues

Item.Name: Church of Jesus Christ of the Latter Day Saints
Spiritualism
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes both the philosophy which rates the spiritual above the materialistic view of life, and belief in the possibility of communication with the spirits of the dead.

Item.Name: Drugs use and abuse
Item.ScopeNotes: The use of drugs for non-medical purposes including drug abuse and addiction

Item.Name: Equal opportunities and diversity
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to the opportunities that individuals meet in selection for education, employment, promotion, and valuing and using the differences in people to their best advantage.

Item.Name: Age discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Unfair treatment of people on the basis of their age, especially where it concerns older people.

Item.Name: Disability discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to employees or prospective employees who are treated less favourably because of a mental or physical disability.

Item.Name: Racial discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Discrimination between individuals on racial grounds, in the context of selection for education, employment and promotion

Item.Name: Religious discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Discrimination between individuals on religious grounds, in the context of selection for education, employment or promotion.

Item.Name: Sexual discrimination
Item.ScopeNotes: Discrimination between individuals on the basis of gender, in the context of selection for education, employment or promotion.

Item.Name: Sheltered employment
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located under Employment terms and conditions; moved in Version 2

Item.Name: Urban communities
Item.ScopeNotes: Applies to the space, facilities and infrastructure available to communities, as well as social aspects.

Item.Name: Volunteering
Item.HistoryNotes: Gained an additional broader term of 'Employment, jobs and careers' in Version 2

Item.Name: NACAB (National Association of Citizen's Advice Bureaux)
Helplines (care services)
Item.ScopeNotes: Telephone support services, some of which provide care advice while others will deliver emergency response.

Item.Name: Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
United Nations
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes UN agencies as well as the central organisation

Item.Name: FAO (Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN)
Public bodies
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes the Cabinet, government departments, executive agencies, devolved administrations, regional development agencies and local government authorities

Item.Name: Girls Venture Corps
Item.HistoryNotes: Moved to under 'Cadet forces' in Version 2. Previously located directly under 'Young people's organisations'

Item.Name: Scouting
Item.HistoryNotes: The preferred term in Version 1 was 'Scouts'. As of Version 2, 'Scouting' has become the preferred term, its scope taking in the whole family of scouting organisations, and 'Air scouts' and 'European scouts' have been demoted to non-preferred status.

Item.Name: Beaver Scouts
Item.HistoryNotes: Moved to under 'Scouting' in Version 2. Previously located directly under 'Young people's organisations'.

Item.Name: Cub Scouts
Item.HistoryNotes: Moved to under 'Scouting' in Version 2. Previously located directly under 'Young people's organisations'.

Item.Name: Explorer Scouts
Item.HistoryNotes: Moved to under 'Scouting' in Version 2. Previously located directly under 'Young people's organisations'. At the same time 'Venture scouts', which was a preferred term, has been demoted to non-preferred term, leading in to 'Explorer scouts'.

Item.Name: Learning partnerships
Item.ScopeNotes: With participation from local authorities, schools, colleges, careers offices, community and voluntary sectors, their remit is to improve the planning and coherence of local post-16 learning and hence widen participation in learning, increase attainment, raise standards and help meet the skills challenge.

Item.Name: Key workers
Item.ScopeNotes: Persons employed in a frontline role in the public sector, delivering essential public services in an area where there are serious recruitment and retention problems, and who may therefore be eligible for help with affordable housing

Item.Name: Disabled children
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Disabled people
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Disabled children
Item.RelatedItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Older people
Item.ScopeNotes: People aged 55 years or more

Item.Name: Gifted children
Item.BroaderItem: Special educational needs and additional support

Item.Name: Youth services
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes youth clubs and voluntary youth organisations as well as services provided to young people by statutory bodies

Item.Name: Soldiers, Sailors and Airforce Families Association
Drug-related crime
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes crime in order to finance drug purchase and crime caused by the effects of drugs, but not offences such as drug dealing, which are against the drug laws themselves

Item.Name: Prostitution
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously a non-preferred term; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Theft and burglary
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes theft of vehicles

Item.Name: Violence against the person
Item.ScopeNotes: Excludes domestic violence, sex offences and war crimes

Item.Name: Civil emergencies
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes public emergencies such as widespread forest fires or rail disasters, as well as riots and civil unrest

Item.Name: Adoption rights
Item.ScopeNotes: Special rights concerning pay and leave for employees with an adopted child

Item.Name: Maternity leave
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously non-preferred; promoted to preferred term in Version 2

Item.Name: Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations
Witnesses
Item.HistoryNotes: Previously the preferred term was "Witnesses of crime"; the shortening took place in Version 2

Item.ScopeNotes: Measures to protect data/information from loss, corruption, interference or theft

Item.ScopeNotes: Any scheme organised by groups of owners or residents to protect their property from theft or other types of crime, especially with the support of police authorities

Item.ScopeNotes: Use when no one field of research is specified. Where the research is specific to a subject such as physics, use the subject name, in this case 'Physics'.

Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located only under Public transport; the hierarchical link to Vehicles was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Railway companies
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes companies operating trains and/or tracks and associated facilities

Item.HistoryNotes: Previously located only under Public transport; the hierarchical link to Vehicles was added in Version 2

Item.Name: Satellite dishes

Item.Name: Waterway preservation
Item.ScopeNotes: Protection and conservation of waterways for public enjoyment and recreation
